titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the August Radke papers circa 1950-1989
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Rozlind Koester

publicationstmt.publisher: Western Washington University, Center for Pacific Northwest Studies

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Rozlind Koester 2012
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

did.abstract: These are the personal and professional papers of former Western Washington University history professor August Carl Radke. The collection includes correspondence, speeches, class notes and student files as well as research materials used by Radke in writing "Pacific American Fisheries, Inc.: A History Of A Washington State Salmon Packing Company, 1890-1966."

scopecontent.p: These are the personal and professional papers of former Western Washington University history professor August Carl Radke. The collection includes correspondence, speeches, class notes and student files as well as research materials used by Radke in writing "Pacific American Fisheries, Inc.: A History Of A Washington State Salmon Packing Company, 1890-1966."

accessrestrict.p: Some access restrictions may apply - contact repository for details.

userestrict.p: Some access restrictions may apply - contact repository for details.

prefercite.p: August Radke papers, Center for Pacific Northwest Studies, Western Libraries Archives & Special Collections, Western Washington University, Bellingham WA 98225-9123.

processinfo.head: About Harmful Language and Content
processinfo.p: To learn more about problematic content in our collections, collection description and teaching tools (including how to provide feedback or request dialogue on this topic), see the following Statement About Potentially Harmful Language and Content

acqinfo.p: Initial donation made by August Radke in 1989 with an addition from Carol Radke in 2002.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material also housed at the Center for Pacific Northwest Studies includes the Galen Biery papers and photographs, and the Pacific American Fisheries records.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
